channel.title: Pwning on PwnFuzz Blog!
channel.description: Recent content in Pwning on PwnFuzz Blog!

item.title: Overlapping Chunks: GLIBC 2.27 Heap Exploitation
item.description: This is going to be an in-depth explaination of the overlapping chunks techniques on GLIBC 2.27, this technique can also be produced on the GLIBC 2.

item.title: ret2csu - A Return Oriented Programming Technique
item.description: This is an in-depth guide on ret2csu technique. I tried to make this article as much detailed as I could, including references and some binary to practice it with.

item.title: ROP - ret2libc attack
item.description: Today, I will show you how to use Return Oriented Programming for doing a ret2libc attack. Foreword #This is much more harder than what we encountered earlier, unlike before we won’t have any function preloaded with strings like /bin/cat flag.

item.title: ROP- Basic Exploit Creation
item.description: This blog post will teach you basics of ROP i.e. how to use tools efficiently. Overview #This post is more practical, so tag along with radare2, pwntools, gdb and ropper ready.

item.title: Introduction to ROP
item.description: This blog post will let you know about the ROP or Return Oriented Programming. What is ROP? #Return Oriented Programming is a modern method of exploiting a binary that will allow us to take control of the stack and the abuse program’s control flow by the help of gadgets.

item.title: Binary Exploitation - Format String + Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
item.description: A detailed guide to use a format string vulnerability to bypass protections and use the buffer overflow vulnerability to get a shell.
